title: Robinson Arpi
quote: "If you can imagine it, you can program it"

about.p1: I studied at the Faculty of Engineering of the University of Cuenca. I am immersed in the world of web development and data analysis. I constantly strive to learn and apply existing technologies in the best possible way. I seek to understand the complexities of problems to find solid and efficient solutions.
about.p2: The resilience is a quality I consider essential on this path, as facing challenges and overcoming obstacles is an integral part of the development process. In my academic and practical journey, I have demonstrated a strong ability to adapt and learn quickly, fundamental characteristics in a constantly evolving environment.
about.p3: When I'm not working or spending time with friends, I devote my time to learning about various topics. I believe that the limit of our universe lies in what we know.

first.title: Research Assistant - IDE Ucuenca
first.description: I worked for the Spatial Data Infrastructure Group at the University of Cuenca. During my time there, I was in charge of an open-source project involving the platforms GeoNode and MapStore. I carried out the following tasks: Editing and Customization: Adapted and customized GeoNode and MapStore to meet the specific needs of the group. Dockerization and Deployment: Containerized the applications using Docker and managed their deployment on the university's servers. Maintenance and Updates: Performed maintenance and updates on old servers to ensure optimal operation and system security.

second.title: Junior Developer - FuturaEc
second.description: During my pre-professional internships, I developed a system for the early detection of elevated assets in cooperatives, improving the management and control of resources. I implemented the solution using Spring Boot for the backend, Angular for the frontend, and Flask for additional services, ensuring an efficient and scalable architecture. I was responsible for all stages of the project, from the initial design to the final deployment, including complex calculations and testing to ensure the system's performance and accuracy.
